Fly in elsewhere when possible.

Not a bad airport, although it is sprawling, so if you have limited time between flights you will want to be ready to run.  You feel the humidity as soon as you walk off the plane, BANG.  The airport was pretty easy to get around, but it is a busy airport.  There is free WiFi, so you can catch up on life.  The other thing that I liked was that the food court had tables next to power outlets (so you could charge your laptop or iPhone while you eat).

In terms of the eateries, you have your standard airport stuff, nothing out of the ordinary.  I find that top notch airports have unique food to the area, Charlotte felt standard.

It's a nice airport to have a layover in. Free wifi is only for 45 minutes but there are tons of eateries, shopping and even a spa. 
The only thing that sucks is if you have a short layover and have to run from one end of the airport to the other to make your plane.  It's a HUGE airport.
On my layover on my way out I did get to enjoy a great lox sandwich at Einstein Bros Bagels.  
On my way back I had 15 minutes to get to my plane.  I suppose I should have asked one of the carts for help.

Friendly, easy going, they didn't have room in the plane but let me try to stuff it above my head, people were obv a lot nicer then at the NYC airport, they were effcient.
Free wifi always makes my day too. :)

CLT is very easy to navigate through and with Pre-check at this airport getting to your gate is easy.

Love the large food court as soon as you go through the checkpoint.

Tiny little airport that does what it needs to do - one could also fly directly into Atlanta and catch the shuttle out to Chattanooga, which I might do next time and avoid the joy of flying on a small plane. Taxi to downtown Charlotte is about $30
I mean, it's an airport.  It's okay and has some nice places for a drink while you wait for your flight.  Bathroom I went to was clean, and staff was nice.
Bathroom attendant doing a fine job, but this was the worst airport wifi experience I've had ... maybe ever. Huge waste of a layover.

Nice airport, friendly folks but the basic need of internet access has been completely overlooked. This is a basic need of business and non-business travelers alike. Internet is very cheap and should be provided accordingly. Someone at Charlotte Douglas International Airport has really dropped the ball, penny wise and pound foolish. They obviously do not want to be taken seriously as a major and competent transportation hub providing needed services to their customers - disappointing and frustrating. Fixit Charlotte Douglas International Airport. Its not that expensive or difficult.

CLT is a pretty standard run of the mill airport with some of the concourses having better options than others when it comes to food choices. CLT is a major hub for American Airlines, so you're likely to find better choices for food outside of concourse A which is used for all other airlines. All of the concourses have adequate seating and the interconnecting hallways have rocking chairs for your leisure. I agree with the other reviews about the weirdness that are bathroom attendants. I think I can tend to my hygiene independently, thanks. 

The parking situation has much improved since the short term garage was opened. This garage directly faces the airport and is shared with the rental car counters\/parking. If you are driving to the airport, the signage can be confusing so hang out in the left most lane to find the entrance to the garage. Construction is still ongoing so there is a tent that connects the garage to the airport awning. Parking in short term is free for the first half hour, which is great if you need to meet someone at baggage claim. There are also four long term lots with routine bus shuttles outside of baggage claim. My most preferred is long term 1 because it is the closest to the airport. My least preferred is long term 4 because of the poor lighting at night, which makes it difficult to find your car if you have a late returning flight.
Easy to park at the long term lots and at a good rate.  Security lines are annoyingly long for not that busy of an airport.  Usually because they only have 1 scanner open at a time.

I hate hate hate hate hate this airport, because I hate US Air.  The airport's atrium nearly saves it, but then it all falls apart on the way in and out.

Pros:
+  This place is big, plenty of services from a modern wine bar to coffeeshops and retail locations.  Even a sushi bar and piano player.
+  The layout is pretty simple, and they try to keep it pleasant, they even have rocking chairs.
+ Clean and spacious
+ Free WiFi that's actually pretty decent.

Cons:
- US Air hub... I get delayed every single time... occasionally I get cancelled.
- All of the nice things I just mentioned in the Pros go away the moment you walk into the wings.  Gotta love a dilapidated Sbarros or chicken chain. 
- This all goes to the h - e - double hockey sticks when you try to leave.  The bus and taxi area is a completely insane clusterexplative.  I can't even understand what is happening with this, or why I'm standing in the wrong spot every time I try to reach the parking lot or the hotel.  Signage would help.

The atrium makes me want to like CLT, but the everything outside of the main area only serves to remind me I'm working around US Air.  This airport could be better, but even the free wifi can't help.  Maybe if they can refurbish the wings, it can get to 3 stars.

Worst airport ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Delays for no reason and no accommodations after being pushed back to the next day for a flight. The lady told me I could sleep on the floor for my 12 hour layover! Hahahaha. What a joke! Now I'm on the first flight out and it's delayed AGAIN!!!!!!!!! Fuck this bullshit airport. Unless you want to be extremely delayed\/ or miss your connection I do NOT recommend!

I've never felt compelled to review an airport before, but I was incredibly impressed with Charlotte international airport! From the plentiful white rocking chairs throughout the terminal to the soothing voice with the standard airport announcements, an all in all pleasant experience. Artistically, the highlight for me was quirky\/wonderful art installation showing every mode of flight in a fanciful way (above Hissho Sushi on Concourse C). But what I appreciate most is the filtered water stations at each restroom water fountain for refilling water bottles--it is so forward thinking given the fact that everyone gets dehydrated in flight, is prohibited from packing water to carry aboard, and prefers not to be charged the exorbitant prices airports stores generally charge for single use water bottles. Great job!!

I was told this was a small airport so I went mentally prepared.

Boy was they wrong! Yes it may be smaller than ATL airport but I love that they have great options to choose from with food. Not to ass Charlotte is one of my fav places.

I like the way this airport is laid out. 
While you may have to walk a bit...at least it is all well marked and clean and fun to walk thru. 

Wish I could get one of the rockin' chairs. They always are full when I pass thru. 
The BBQ is really nice............Carolina Pit Barbecue. 
A little pricey but that is the way airports operate. 

The Wright Brother plane replica is nice to see as you walk toward E area. Interesting to note that the plane is higher off the ground then the real Flyer ever got!

Wow, this is my new favorite airport. I've connected through here a few times and have now come to appreciate its excellence. It's really large but surprisingly accessible (5 terminals, but all connected by walkways, no need for a shuttle\/tram) with tons of moving walkways. Everything is well marked with giants maps aplenty. I had no trouble getting around. 

I'm currently enjoying the main hall area where I am 1) sitting in a huge row of rocking chairs nestled among real trees, 2) listening to a live pianist, 3) considering which of the great airport food choices I'm going to take advantage of, and 4) enjoying fast, free wifi. Is this southern hospitality? If so, consider me charmed.

The real clincher for me though have been the people. Within five minutes of landing, I saw several oversized go-karts driving people who have mobility difficulty (and it doesn't seem pre-arranged, I saw one lady walk up and inquire and they just got her on).  I've now overheard multiple drivers who have been exceedingly patient and friendly with the often elderly travelers.  Random employees have been unfazed by being stopped for directions. The restroom attendant was happy and friendly, and the bathroom was in great shape.

Suffice it to say that for future flights, I would welcome the opportunity to connect through Charlotte and give this airport business. It has connecting flights all over the US and into South America and Europe, so that probably won't be difficult!

Not a bad airport. Lots of shops and restaurants in the food court area (love the Body Shop location and Cinnabon). 

However, the E-D (regional) terminal is ridiculous. You pretty much have to go through a magical door to Wonderland to get there. It seems like the flow of traffic could be much more efficient here....but it was forgotten or something.

the rocking chairs in the middle is pretty neat. very southern... only airport\/place in the tri-state area that has jamba juice.

free wifi if I remember correctly...

This airport made an impression on my from the beginning. The amazing atrium with the rocking chairs and piano music adds a touch of elegance that harkens back to the golden era of travel. Lines were unfortunately long and this airport seems subject to a disproportionate number of folks who are still somehow unaware of TSA regulations, making security take 5x longer than necessary. Staff was very polite and as efficient as they could be, the airport itself is very clean, has many great options for food and even offers free wifi! Whether this is your destination or a layover spot, it's pretty ideal as airports go. I always look forward to Charlotte-Douglas!

Charlotte has always been a great airport. Very clean and recently updated. For layovers there are tons of food and shopping options. The TSA is super quick too for security. 

However, you're usually on a 10-15 minute minimum delay when departing- probably due to the high volume of flights??? Anyways, beware if you have a short layover elsewhere.

Before going through security this airport seems small and quaint, but beyond that it's pretty expansive. The security lines move fast enough, and the TSA agents are some of the nicest I've ever had feel me up.

Overall a fine place to fly in or out. It's clean and has all the standards you'd expect at an airport.

This seems like the type of place that will be good in a few years. There is a LOT of construction\/renovation going on right now and quite a bit of confusion as a result. The parts that aren't currently undergoing renovation are definitely dated and need updating soon, so hopefully it doesn't take too long to finish up what they've already started.

airport looked clean and nice, and free wifi. anywhere that has free wifi is cool with me.

eric b

This airport has the absolute WORST and SLOWEST security lines in the country, bar none!

In addition, there is ONE WHOLE SECURITY LINE at the D-GATE for PreCheck only - that has TSA Employees standing around doing NOTHING because the percentage of travelers that have PreCheck is about 1% or less.  Really? ...........Really?

WTF!  Our Government and the TSA are so out of touch in this location it is just outrageous, period. How come the Charlotte Airport Authority doesn't intervene and explain to the TSA management that this has to improve? 

This is why I absolutely HATE this airport, but I still love the City of Charlotte!

BTW, The Tampa International Airport TSA do a great job, and are friendly and efficient!

On my way back from a memorable trip down Souff...I get to enjoy Charlotte Int'l for a bit. 
Many restaurants (both local and national), shops, kiosks, etc and other spots to drain a few extra bucks out of you while you're 'trapped' here.

I do like the old school rocking chairs throughout the concourses. I like the charging stations everywhere as all the major airports have. I like the filtered  water refilling stations throughout. the airport as well.   I would LOVE a lil POS kiosk with some booze in it as well, so we can deal with the chatty passengers\/seat kicking kids\/loud talking mofo's that every flight seems to have.

Overall a great layout, long walks to connecting flights, comfy chairs, nice and helpful employees.  Can't ask for much more.   Thumbs up

Not bad for a hub, enough to see and eat to keep you busy for a bit but watch out for the creepy bathroom attendants.  You feel like you stepped out of the airport and into a sleazy nightclub when you hit the WC.

Between ATL and CLT I would fly through Charlotte any day of the week.

Like others have mentioned, this is a major hub for US Airway -- so nearly all the planes you'll see are US Air.

I've connected through here many, many times and Charlotte has never been my final destination. One time I spent the night in Charlotte, courtesy of missed connections, air traffic control in Philly, ughhh... (you get the pt.)

But yes, this is a rather larger airport. All the International flights are in one terminal  - -D. Smaller regional flights are out of E. But since I'm typically coming in from or going to PHX, those domestic flights (for US Air) are in B or C. 

Let me tell you...if you land at the end of say B, and you have a connection to a regional in E -- you better book it! There are people movers... but it could be a long jaunt for some. 

I like the white rocking chairs in the middle area. Makes me feel a bit relaxed.... as I am running past them on the people mover. (I don't think I've ever tried them yet -- but they look cute!)

US Airways club -- well, there's one. A large one. However if you're traveling Internationally, it's not an Envoy lounge and therefore not as large as the lounge in Philly. But it's still a nice lounge with great views. 

Plenty of various food options. And a Body Shop store, which is convenient for me when I'm flying back to PHX. Then... I can buy items that are over 3oz. to carry on.

This is a good airport for first-time flyers, as it's not terribly large and overwhelming like ATL. There are plenty of food options, from standard fast food to sit-down restaurants. Many of the places are open pretty early. It is bright, clean, and there is plenty of seating. Bathrooms are clean and there is an attendant on duty. It can get crowded like any other airport, but security moves pretty fast.

I have never had a smooth experience here - be it an hour wait on the runway or having to bolt thru the airport full-speed to make my connection, something is always a pain in my back when flying thru Charlotte.

One of the best airports in the country.  Very well run, lots of options for food, good selection of shops, and pretty easy to get from one place to the other. Even plenty of parking options!  And, the rocking chairs are brilliant!

I was going to complain on one point about airport management, until I did some checking... As it turns out the biggest problem that the Charlotte Airport has is that it is under some control of the Charlotte City Council.  There is where I have my biggest beef!  They decided last November to remove all ATM's except for Bank of America's ATM's.  How dumb.  Okay, I know - they got paid a lot of money!!  Well, why don't you check with McDonald's too?!  They would probably pay you a fortune if you made it the only FOOD available in the airport!!  But wouldn't THAT make a lot of people happy!!

What you've done is simply to inconvenience a lot of people. I won't pay fees to use other ATM's so I can no longer get cash at the airport.

http:\/\/www.charlotteobserver.com\/2011\/11\/15\/2777229\/council-makes-bofa-sole-source.html

CRT IMHO is a tough review to write about. I had mixed feelings about this airport because the negatives easily outweigh the positives. Here's my perspective from someone who's visited CRT for the first time:

Positives: 
-Clean throughout
-Charging stations at each gate
-Lots of food options (Liked the 1897 market)
-Concourses clearly marked with large signage
-Airport staff are courteous, friendly and helpful
-US customs lines were long but steadily moving
-Ditto for the TSA lines


Negatives:

-Crowded (even on a weekday!) 
-US customs kiosk not friendly to the height challenged. (I had to jump to take my photo and I looked ridiculous doing so.) 
-Navigation through customs, baggage claims and TSA can be confusing at times. After coming off the plane, I found a lot of people standing around lost trying to figure out where to go next. I found this to be a problem with noobs like myself, immigrants and the elderly. Had Ben not been there to help me get around, I would've been completely lost. Not knowing where to go held up the lines and caused major traffic jam. They have staff on hand to guide you through this part to help you get to your next destination but, clearly, there weren't enough. There are a variety of ways this could be improved through use of more signage, staff and perhaps a line to corral people into going the right direction. 
-No cellphones can be used in the customs area. Use your cellphone and it will get confiscated. Poo.
-No clocks in the customs area. I wanted to know what time it was but couldn't take out my cell phone. Double Poo.

Side note for international travelers: As soon as you get off the plane, just have your passport, customs form, baggage claim ticket and boarding pass in your hand. You can't believe how many people fail to do this and then hold the line up because their frantically digging through their pockets and purses to get them. Sigh. People!!! If your going to hold the line up, have the common courtesy to pull off to the side and obtain your items! DO NOT HOLD UP THE LINE!!! There are others trying to get to their plane in a short amount of time. Getting through an already crowded airport is nerve wracking enough. Don't be that dick and make the experience worse.

Love the layout and size of this airport. So easy to navigate. The central food\/shopping area has some nice options and the big white rocking chairs are so southern and inviting. My kids love the moving sidewalks between the terminals. Always happy to fly to Charlotte!

A conference was flying me from California to Indiana, by way of North Carolina, on US Airways. 

I pretty much wandered around the terminal waiting for my connecting flight in some way astonished that I was in the same state the first successful airplane flight occurred. And in my flying in and out of the state I felt in a very small way connected to that extraordinary shred of human achievement. 

Then I snapped out of it, took a nap, and woke up somewhere over West Virginia.

Not a fan at all.  

Although the place is bright and clean I found the airport staff to be extremely unfriendly.

The bathroom attendents are sort of weird too.

Free wi-fi is always a plus! Buy long distances between certain terminals for US Airways made it hard to get across. Airports need to work with airlines on getting commuter turboprops closer to the big guys....or make it easier to transport people in dedicated lines.

CLT is top of my list of airports I have gone through in terms of friendliness.  I am referring to airport workers and TSA.  Other reviewers have commented about airlines and I don't think those comments should be directed to the airport.  When I say friendliness, I mean from entering the airport to going through security.  No rude or overzealous TSA like you see at OAK, SFO, PHX, OGG (yes, Maui!).

I'm really torn about this airport. I want to like you for the free wifi, the rocking chairs, and the almighty - BOJANGLES BISCUITS!!

But i hate you for your slow customs line that made me run to my connecting flight narrowly making it (yet my bags did not!), the lack of duty free stores in my terminal, and otherwise lame retailers. 

if it werent for Bojangles, I would have given this airport 2stars.

This is a nice size, well organized airport. I also like the surplus of options available to travelers AFTER you get through the TSA security. I thought it was neat to see at the US Airway's reservation\/check-in area that there was a "minor unaccompanied" area so you can get your child through the process easily.

I spent quite a few hours in this airport between flights - on the side before the security gates, there's a Starbucks that's practically open 24 hours (sometimes it closes I hear).

Speaking of Starbucks, there are several locations on the secure side. Also on this side are shops and eateries galore, including local eateries I've never heard of like a tequila bar (Tequilerja).

There is a business center where you can rent a laptop or internet connection I believe, and there are conference rooms\/halls upstairs. It's clean, bright, and sunny. Rocking chairs rock.

If I ever get stuck here again, I'm renting a car and hanging in Charlotte.

You gotta love the Puddle Skipper. Charlotte is so cool. Coming on Jet Blue is easy and no lag or drag getting in. 

This is a nice Airport and certainty a simple place getting into and out. 

I wish there was more like Charlotte meaning the Airport Service Schedule.
Surprisingly clean and quite easy airport!  Had wonderful service and bags were quick to be unloaded.  Very easy in and out approach.

Outside security at the departures area was SUPER rude today. EVERYONE stops at departures to let people out. It's a drop off, can't stay for more than a minute or two, no big deal. So dropped people off and he came over to say that we had to wrap up our goodbyes and i needed to keep driving - absolutely fine, drove right away. It wasn't a busy time and no cars were waiting for my spot but I understand they need to keep it moving. I pulled out and away and realized I didn't know which way I was headed so I moved towards the end and pulled over to SAFELY put the address in the nav. 45 seconds later he walks alllll the way down to yell at me and say he's giving me a ticket because he told me once and if I needed to put that in my nav I should have done it at the other end. I told him again I just needed to put the address in the nav system because I didn't know where I was and how to get there and his response was that he was going to give me a ticket. I then asked him if he could just tell me which direction to go - he only cared about telling me he was giving me a ticket because he mentioned it three more times.

I found this airport to be very clean and modern. Its not the largest airport (compared to Newark, JFK, or LGA), so there isn't an overwhelming amount of places to grab food, but they had several solid choices.
 Every time I've been here, everything  ran very efficiently - much more so than Newark airport. 
On my last trip I was through security and at my gate less than five minutes after arriving.
If you have your Global Entry card, International is a breeze. Less than 5 minutes total.
They have FREE Wifi, which is a bonus. Its not blazingly fast, but its free.
They have the TSA precheck gates which is a good bonus.

An odd note - they have rocking chairs you can sit in lol I didn't get a chance to try them, but its on my list for next time!

In my opinion, the CLT airport is one of the best around.  The terminal is clean, each concourse is accessible with the exception of E which can be a hike from the end of B.  There are plenty of restaurants to eat at, plenty of shops.  And I love the rocking chairs and the piano player in the main terminal.

And as much as people hate US Airways, I actually enjoy the fact that they have their largest hub in CLT and you can fly non-stop to almost anywhere.

Parking is a breeze.  I usually use long-term parking which is only $4 a day and it's really not far from the airport.  The shuttles are normally timed pretty well where you are not waiting long.

My only complaint is the lack of restaurants in the ticketing and baggage areas.  My family used to use CLT as a layover point because I could meet them there and spend time there.  But since 9\/11 I am no longer allowed beyond the security checkpoint.  Maybe that will change when the terminal is expanded again which I hear is coming.

All the nice things reviewers say about this airport are true, but none of it makes up for the insane layout, which has also been reviewed.  It is MILES between Terminal E, where small commuter planes arrive, and the other terminals.  The moving sidewalks are few and short, and travel slower than you can walk.  Even the ubiquitous golf-type carts are of limited help since after traversing the endless Terminal E (39 gates in a straight line) they have to stop at the escalators to the rest of the terminals.  If you are coming or going from Terminal E to anywhere else in the airport, don't even think of less than a 90 minute transfer.  Then you might get to enjoy some of the amenities and possibly make your connection.
What's Chicago is to American, Charlotte is to US airways. This time while connecting to NYC saw this guy napping with this hoodie  on a Valentines Day morning.

We'd heard that getting through Customs and TSA was a nightmare here, and I now have to agree. There are long, long lines with employees standing around, talking, socializing, etc., while only one security lane is open. Additionally, it was so poorly managed, we all waited while the belt was halted until someone brought more plastic bins to place our belongings in. We BARELY made our connecting flight, yet we had 1.5 hours to do so. Unacceptable. Do yourself a favor and try to fly through a different airport.
Easy airport, well ongoing construction is a bit of a pain right now. Lines are usually not very long. I like it.

CLT is a solid and steady airport.  No, I doubt you'll ever be super excited to find it your layover destination.  However, it will meet your needs, especially if you're flying US Air (CLT is a hub location).  Free wifi, good signage, and a few options to keep you entertained is probably all you need.

I landed internationally and had to make it through customs and security in less than an hour-twenty to make my connection.  Maybe being seated towards the front helped, but I did it all in less than a half hour (didn't have a bag checked), which allowed me to get on stand-by for an earlier flight.  Bravo!

Just wondering if this is the only airport that has manned restrooms , seems weird
Other than that would love to someday have a Delta Skyclub
Thanks

US Airways flight arrived early but we sat in the airplane for awhile so we had to rush all the way across the airport to depart on our connecting flight. I thought we weren't going to make in on time. 

We had a stroller and our toddler was tired and wanted to ride but the sliding walkways state "no strollers" so my wife and child got on one of the extremely slow golf carts they use for customers who cannot walk.

I sprinted and awaited my wife and child's arrival at our departing gate on the extremely slow golf cart.

Meanwhile, our plane is boarding passengers and I am getting antsy.

I am wondering how we can arrive early and almost miss our flight?
Why do they have no tram?
Why do we have to traverse such a large area between our arrival and departing flights to begin with?  

At other airports, the gates are in close proximity.  Maybe this is common for some airports afterall, I have only flown into\/out of about a dozen different airports; but I am guessing that they could do alot better with this.

A tram would help.
And maybe better planning.
Focus on customer service.

Just my opinion.

Lee

This is a large enough airport that combines both modern concourses with old ones. It is very easy to arrive or leave by car if not in the rush hour of Charlotte traffic. 
It has many options for food (from fast food to seat in). I love flying into or out of this location.

Hopefully you will get to enjoy piano music in the main concourse.  I was waiting on my plane and got to enjoy a free concert by another traveler who just parked his carry on beside the piano and launched into song after song.  It made me wonder how much talent is walking around us everyday and we're not ever aware of it.

I like all the shops there and I try to browse all of them each time I come.  I did find a cool sleeve for my old kindle for only $10 and that was a good find.

The only thing I would suggest is some cooler designs on the Charlotte Tshirts and I'll buy some.  And where is the UNCC logo apparrel?  Represent!

My first time at this airport. It was bigger than I thought it would be which was cool. All of the attendants were friendly and helpful. I really liked that you walk across the street after you get your bags to get your rental car. No shuttles! Yay!

As I fly a lot to Pensacola, Florida, I am always making a transfer at this airport. Wether my lay over is 20 minutes, or 2 hours, I am always entertained during the time I have to wait.

There is a starbucks in every terminal, which is fantastic because after my first flight,  I am always exhausted. In the main terminal, there are tons of food options, as well as some shopping. I really enjoy the stir fry place in the food court, their spicy options are top notch.

The bathroom attendants at CLT are SO friendly. They will make sure you are satisfied with the cleanliness and keeping of the restrooms.

My only advice is to make sure you leave yourself enough time to get to each terminal, since this is a huge airport and very spaced out.

Since my "planned" time here was to be short, I didn't explore as much as it turns out I actually had time for due to delays.  Considering my first delay included a terminal change, this allowed for a good idea of what should be expected from the remainder of the airport.  There are several shopping opportunities (MAC makeup store caught my eye), including Duty Free shopping.  While traveling over a 4th of July weekend and though the airport had no shortage of travellers, the restrooms (place not too far apart) were clean and without lines.

I was definitely comfortable while moving from gate to gate; and in between was happy with the multitude of eatery options.  I stopped at Phillips Seafood for a $21 crab cake sandwich & fries.... but that's a separate review. 

My gate (D6) had a double sided charging station and seats a plenty.   I'd be happy to layover here again!

Great airport. Free internet access. Easy access to gates. Decent food. Restrooms are a little dated. Security is usually fast. Weather causes resulting in delays seems to be common here though, so that's unfortunate. Besides that, I think this is the perfect size airport for travel.

I'm in Charlotte very often as a flight crewmember, and it's one of my preferred airports.  Free wifi, nice food options, lots of places to sit and recharge.  Not a huge fan of the fact that everything is carpeted, it makes it a little harder to wheel your luggage around, but it's not a big deal.  The airport is laid out pretty well, and has lots of signage to find your way around.  I do like how they have "Walk" and "Stand" actually painted onto the moving sidewalks, now only if they could get people to actually adhere to that.

I have passed through this air port a couple of times here lately.  The first trip was a 5 hour lay over.  That wasn't so fun, but  what was fun....I was able to grab a Cinnabon and coffee and sit in the rocking chairs underneath a big ass plane....YEAH I said that.  I sit in a white rocking chair (like i was at Cracker Barrel or my granny's house), eating my ginormous Cinnabon, drinking my coffee while sitting underneath a big ass plane hanging from the ceiling.  It was kind of surreal.  
Another time I passed through here, I stopped at California Pizza Kitchen grabbed a bite.  I wish I would have kept walking.  That place left alot to be desired.  
Everything else here was ho hum after traveling from Vegas.  The bathrooms here also seemed to be always broken or being cleaned.  I don't know what that is all about.  This is the biggest reason for their 3 star.  They would be lower if it wasn't for the cinnamon roll under the plane while rocking.  Most people in airports need to learn to slow down and take it all in.  I think they will enjoy life more.

Wow.  Such a sad lot of reviews here, and they all seem to be from people with a specific complaint\/bad experience.  I guess people aren't motivated to Yelp their good experiences...

Maybe I'm biased because I came through LAX and PHL before coming through here, but it's the cleanest and best-maintained of the bunch.

Yes, the restrooms are staffed and there's a tip jar.  And reviewers are complaining about it????  Tips aren't mandatory, but after the disgusting restroom in PHL, I gladly fished in my purse and forked over 75 cents to the attendant who was keeping the place spotless.  And I do mean spotless.

Atriums and rocking chairs are both nice touches that make the airport feel hospitable even for a long layover.  Yes, the airport is a bit stretched out for the numbers of overall gates, but it allows for nice atriums, spaces to chill, and more restaurants and other amenities for travelers.  I also imagine it allows the airport more room to grow in the future.  I can see how commuter fliers (or those running late) might not appreciate the sprawl, though.

Free Wifi took 60 seconds to connect to.  Several outlets available for free charging in the atria.

Seating, carpet, fixtures all in good shape\/well-maintained.  Signage better than most airports (especially liked the map of restaurants\/shops\/amenities.)  And thumbs up for the trio of trash cans for recycling!

Seems to me like CLT took a few cues from Eurpoean airports.

Easy connection to light rail system (which I also liked) and very good wayfinding signage overall.

CLT, you almost had 5 stars:

Minus 1 star for Wifi not working in the main center shopping\/eating area AND for having all your shops and restaurants close at either 8 or 9 PM!!!!  For an airport of its size, I was shocked.  I wanted to grab Beachwood Farms (Carolina BBQ, fast-food-service-style), but they were closed and cleaning up at 8:30.  Even the bar was shut down!  Spent my last hour at the gate when I would've preferred to have been spending money on a second drink and a nice dinner.
I had a layover at this airport.  Seemed very clean and the staff was nice and helpful.  Plenty of good food options.  Bathrooms were clean.
I love that this airport is so easy to get to, however I hate how busy it has become. They are constructing more buildings but there needs to be a quicker way through security.

A small airport that needs some improvement. 
This place seems to be in the middle of a big rebuilding effort. Most of the terminal is done, but the parking garages and car rental areas are still under construction. 
The lines for security here are long. Bored TSA agents mindlessly repeat the same instructions over and over. "Shoes off! Laptops out!" 
There aren't many places to eat here. I love it when local restaurants are featured in the airport. Not here. Wendy's is one of the slim choices for food. 
Long moving sidewalks take you past movie posters of feature films that were shot in the Charlotte area. There were a lot of car racing films shot here, and Evil Dead II! 
There aren't too many things to see or do here. No big public works of art. No interesting shops. Just newsstands and fast food. 
The traffic here is maddening. At the arrivals area, traffic is slowed to a slow snarl, and it takes for ever to get out of there. 
I'm not a big fan of this airport.

This is the worst airport I've ever had the displeasure of passing through. Sure, there are some decent places to eat, but every single time I have to make a connection through Charlotte Douglas it's delayed by several hours. I haven't been to any other airport with as many delays and with such frequency. I'd gladly sacrifice the Pinkberry for a more punctual schedule.

This is one of my favorite airports. There's a lot to do (it's practically a mall) and lots of restaurants. Also a Starbucks around every corner. But anyway, I don't mind having a 3-hour layover here because it's big enough to explore and there are plenty of tables in the main concourse to sit down at and work. It could stand to have more walkways for people who have to dart from one terminal to another with heavy luggage... or free wifi...

Very comfortable layover spot that was busy, yet easy to navigate. Only one complaint: the smell of mildew at some of the restaurants in the B & C concourses. I arrived at this airport early in the morning (before 0700) and my thought it that the cleaning cloths were not changed from the day before. I don't know if that was the case but the smell near several of the restaurants was a real deterrent to my entering any of them, even for just a snack.

On a much higher note, there are lovely white rocking chairs dotted throughout the concourses they were reminiscent of an invitation to sit and chat on someone's porch - very nice touch.

Functional, efficient airport that I hope to visit again in my future travels.

I've seen a few American airports by now and i have to say that this one is probarly one the nicest and cleanest i've ever been. 
Nice dining area and great food choices!

Staff is very nice and as far as i relember, there are only a few airport who have restroom attendants.

Great aiport that loses two full stars because f***ing bathroom attendants. Air travel and the airport food isn't expensive enough? We need to remember to bring singles for a guy standing by the sink doing nothing we can't do ourselves? Except then there's that creepy guy who stands in front of your stall while you're trying to travel deuce...

Second time here in a month. Overcrowded, very long lines at the unimpressive overpriced food chain shops.not enough seating at the gates. Very few and far between charging stations and outlets. Walking from 1 gate or terminal to another is so heavily foot-trafficked, there should be lanes for turning and crossing to the other side of the corridor.
The last time I was here I was rushing between flights. Now that I have more time to spend I can see how unpleasant it really is here.
I'd recommend a layover almost anywhere else

I've been flying for over 20 years and flying into Charlotte, NC airport was the worst experience with that I've ever had. So much so I decided to write a review. The layout is so bad that there were people running constantly to catch their connecting flights. I had a connecting flight that had one more stop to Grand Rapids, MI. 3 hour layover turned into 7 and then finally a cancelled flight. 7.5 hours later I was going to connect to Louisville, KY then to Chicago O'hara and then to Grand Rapids, MI however the 7:30am flight was delayed one more time till 9:08am. So finally after 16 hours of being in the very dirty airport I got out of there. I won't mention the airline because I truly feel it's the airport and not the airlines fault. There were circumstances as to why all the flights were cancelled which ranged from weather to crew members not showing up, which may some have been due to weather. But this was going on long before I arrived at 5pm. And weather was not a problem at that point. I believe this airport is not managed well at all and that is where the fault lies.

The inside of the airport is really nice. Lovely rocking chairs near the windows-good luck finding a free one! Lots of options for food and lovely deco. My favorite is the hallway of movie posters featuring movies filmed in NC. 

If you are connecting-great. Beware that parking is a disaster. Be prepared to take your time finding the correct deck. And arrive early!
Nice, easy to navigate through airport. I just wish the gates weren't so close. It was hell when two flights were boarding and they were side by side

I like CLT for a "bigger" airport.   Parking costs me $4 a day which is crazy cheap.  THe food isn't bad, there are some decent stores, and cool rocking chairs.  The secret to the security is check in on the end @ D+E.   Barely ever a line and when there is it moves faster for some odd reason.  Overall never had a problem here and its one of my favorite "bigger" airports.

Nice looking airport but not enough space between the terminals.  Liked the area with the trees and rocking chairs.  But they need to just about double the areas by the gates. No room at all and those golf carts come though every 5 minutes and can't get through the sea of humanity. Bad planning.

Most of my rating is probably based on the rocking chairs that make you feel like you're on the "front porch" of the airport.  I love that.  I also love the city of Charlotte, including the airport.

This is a pretty airport.  There aren't many of those out there.  There's an okay selection of food and things to do here.  Compared to other airports, it's relatively easy to find an unused outlet to charge all your stuff.  We actually got stuck in Charlotte once due to mechanical problems on a plane, and the staff were pretty quick to put us in a nice hotel, with vouchers for breakfast the next morning.

However, bags take forever to show up.  The staff might have been quick to make our hotel arrangements, but the baggage handling people sure took their sweet time getting our stuff back to us.

CLT is definitely one of the friendliest airports for travelers. First, I found the workers at CLT really helpful and engaged. When I was transiting through, I was on crutches (sprained ankle). It was sore enough that I used my crutches but not enough that I needed a wheel chair. As I was limping from Concourse E to B, a number of workers asked me if I would like them to hail down a shuttle car. Gee, I didn't think I was limping that badly :) A couple of shuttle cars also pulled up beside me and asked if I wanted a lift. WOW. I was impressed. I have traveled through some airports where the workers would glare at you if you even "dare" interrupt them to ask a question. 

I also like the fact that there are SO MANY rocking chairs throughout the airport and that they are close to electrical outlets. That plus the fact that CLT provides free WIFI makes this airport really friendly to people who need to plug in and work or browse. Hey BOS, ORD and other major airports, are you listening. 

CLT is definitely on the top of my favorite airports.
Very clean with charging stations all over the place.  Didn't have to walk forever to make connecting flight.  Standard airport chairs but they're comfy compared to what awaits you on the plane.

Lots of US airways flight must mean Charlotte-Douglas is a hub for the airline.

Large clean marbled floor restrooms are convenient. Some terminals even have private family restrooms (where I prefer to go when traveling with my dogs).

Lots of healthy food options. I just had the bombest salad at Salsaritas Fresh Cantina (for under $7).

Though a decent sized airport it's easy to get around. Spacious and uncluttered from the inside. large windows welcome in the sunlight making it bright and thus appearing larger and more spacious than it is. Seats at waiting area near gates are modern and comfortable.

Moviefone sponsors FREE wifi so watch the 30 second add and get online for free!

This place is a dump! Several years ago it started out as 1 of the 10 worst airports I travel through. It is now officially the crappiest major airport in the USA. All the food is crappy, the crowding is terrible, it is difficult to navigate through the terminals, and now the makeover. The thing that is really a shame is that all that they are doing is putting makeup on a pig. The airport is so poorly designed that they need to start over to fix this dump
Unkomplizierter Flugplatz. Abfertigung läuft problemlos und schnell. Diverse Restaurants im Terminal, alles ist schnell zu erreichen.

Disclaimer: I've only passed through this airport for connection flights and I've never had much of a lay over. 

It's not as big as many of the other hubs like Detroit, Atlanta and Minneapolis. But it's still big enough to need a tram of some sort. I've not spotted a tram if there is one here. The moving sidewalks just don't cut it when your connecting flight is already boarding. Many of the moving sidewalks (and there are a lot of them) weren't working, as in out of service. Even an escalator was out of service. If you've ever wondered what it's like to tote a carry on luggage up stairs, I'll inform you that it's not very fun. 

The bathroom had an attendant but the bathroom wasn't as clean as many of the other airport bathrooms that I've used. There weren't any toilet seat covers. Some airports even have the rotating plastic seat covers, so nothing at all is very "behind in the time". 

There was a food court and an area that had rocking chairs. That was a first time that I've noticed rocking chairs in an airport. I didn't use them, it was just another observation, plus I was trying to note something positive about this airport.

Charlotte is usually my layover in transit when I cannot have a straight flight. With that being said I'm going from the gate and I do not have the full TSA, parking or any of the extras worries.

The airport is very clean compared to the others I've been to, the food vendors are decent but lack on healthy eating spots (I try to eat well since I'm about to sit on a plane) and most importantly, the gates are labelled well if I'm in a rush. Did I mention that I love the Southern charm? Well, that's just the nice part of visiting the Southerners.
Standard place that grew fast and has lots of spider webs.

This airport has not evolved or grown to accommodate its business. Similar to PHL; it is over capacity at each gate, does not have enough power outlets (let alone designated power stations), and lack of hot food choices in each terminal make is a dismal place for a layover.

I personally feel awkward with bathroom attendants present as well. I prefer not to have an audience.
Terrible service! The staff was not helpful what so ever.. Very rude! I will never fly from here again! The airport is easy to get around but after my terrible experience I won't return

Large airport that has lots of great connections when using US Airways. Its also very well laid out and easy to get between terminals quickly.

The airport itself is huge and overall pretty nice. Good selection of restaurants to kill time at as well. One interesting thing about it is that they have a serious recycling and composting initiative. They strangely don't advertise it very well as I found out through a bartender who was explaining it to me.

This was such an adorable airport!

They have hundreds of white, wooden rocking chairs lining all the walls, nooks, and crannies of the airport for passengers to sit and relax and kick back while they wait for their flights!

Major cuteness overload.

I felt like this was a super crowded airport compared to the like six other airports I had been to on this trip and I felt like the seats were super worn out and raggedy and they did not have near enough charging stations to go around.

Also, They only give you 45 minutes of free wifi at a time...

Who does that??

It's 2016 Charlotte, pull it together.

When on the road and flying to many cities on the East Coast, I always chose CLT over PHL or even PHX at times do to a multitude of reasons which are listed below:

- A lot less busy then PHL

-Immigration and customs are a breeze compared to other major gateways like PHL, EWR, JFK, MIA etc....

-Hub for USAirways

-Lots of great little restaurants and a couple of USAir clubs

-ROCKING CHAIRS! How cool is that? 

-Weather does not seem to affect this airport as much as others... ahem PHL

-Free WIFI! 

Thanks CLT for being an awesome airport to transit through. Now if only USAIr could improve their service.

this place is nice lots of shops, clean and good choices on places to eat. the free high speed internet is very fast. like the other reviewer said you have to try Phillips seafood in terminal C..excellent service and food there is off the hook. only here for a quick layover so I will write a review about Phillips later.
For some reason I always have to connect between terminal E and terminal A. As a hub it's pretty busy so hoof it to your next gate!

I really really hate this airport. It is always a bitch flying in and out of it. Not to mention that 2 out of the 4 times I've flown through and had a connecting flight, they've lost my bag during the transfer from one plane to the next including my returning from Dublin. Trust me, when you've been flying 12 hours and have two connections before reaching your final destination, the last thing you want to worry about is if your bag is going to be there when you arrive. This indeed happened, and I didn't get my bag for 3 days. That was a mess since I had been living in another country for six months and everything in there was all I'd had. 

I try to avoid Charlotte airport at all costs unless it is my absolute final destination which has yet to ever be the case.

I'm used to Birmingham's small airport I guess. This place was pretty big. Or maybe it seemed so since I had to run from one terminal to another, and they were on the complete opposite ends of the airport from one another. And I had to run back once i found out my standby flight wasn't going to make it, and to get on another flight back where I came from. Ahhh.... the adventures of flying. Thankfully, the staff were friendly and didn't mind my questions.

A lot has changed about this airport over the years. They are in the middle of renovations currently. 

My favorite memories about this airport were coming when my aunts and uncles from out of town, and my mom would bring us to pick them up. This was pre-9\/11 when you could walk to the gates. My younger sister and I were fascinated by the order and the planes. But this airport has greatly changed since the mid-1980's since my first visits. It wasn't until my first flight in the early 1990's, in my late teens that I was able to fulfill my dream of boarding a plane and departing the gate. This airport has changed over the years to match with the times. I do like how there are charging stations for electronics. There are still spots of major construction, from the drop-off and pick-up areas to on the concourses. Everything is neat and clean. On my most recent visit, I only had my carry on so I can not speak about the baggage claim, but, generally speaking, I have never had an issue here with baggage claim. Checking in for flights is fairly easy.

There are plenty of stores near gates to choose from if you have forgotten that last minute gift or book or bottle of water. I have never had simply a layover here, this has always been my origin of start or end to a trip, so I can not speak to the layovers.

It's freakin' huge. If you have connections, you better leave at least :30 minutes between them. At least they have people movers to speed things up, and free wifi if you get to your gate with any time to spare.

I'm obviously biased since I fly out of this airport monthly - but this is one of my favorite airports in America. It is large and spacious without being overwhelming. There is great food and shopping available. I often get there earlier than I need to in order to grab a quick fro-yo from Pinkberry or some fresh sushi before my flight. If you are a US Airways Club member, their club is AAAAWESOMEEE!! It is huge!! There are a ton of snacks available along with coffee, tea, and alcohol. 
There is a lot construction going on around the parking areas so I will say that parking at this airport (despite being extremely cheap) can be a huuuuge pain in the butt. The shuttle service is sub-par and is usually packed to the brim with people and their luggage. If you are planning on parking at the airport, leave plenty of time to actually get to the airport because the shuttle service is quite inefficient.
But for those making connections through CLT, enjoy your short stay :)
After a few visits here, I gotta say, it's not the biggest airport, but it sure is comfortable.

Large airport with lots of flights to many cities.  American (USAIR previously) "owns" the place since it is their hub. There are many restaurants and shops. You can have a hike between gates.  Most times my walk was between .5 and .9 miles.  Thank you fitbit.  They have moving sidewalks.  Food is not as expensive as Atlanta.

I like this airport. It's modern with many shops and restaurants. The central terminal is a hub of activity and great for people watching. The real trees and rocking chairs are a nice touch. Music plays at a tolerable volume. The five concourses branch out from the terminal. Very walkable airport with quick & easy car rentals - and no bus to ride.

Between CLT and ATL - I'll always choose CLT, but my miles are on Delta, so...

Getting around from terminal to terminal is easy-peasy.  Hop on a people-mover and walk briskly that way - you'll fascinate yourself with how much ground can be covered.

Need respite? - Those white rockers occasionally free themselves from others - so when you see an empty one in the main concourse, grab it.  Airport-terminal people watching doesn't get a whole lot better.

Not real impressed. Not as clean as other airports. Definitely needs a facelift.

Stay was short snd sweet...just the way i like it

Our company favors US Air, so we fly through Charlotte every once in a while. We've never flown in to stay, nor out. We've only made connections here. Much appreciated is free WiFi. All airports should be doing that. Rocking Chairs is a great place to chill if you have the time. When making a connection, however, food choices are limited. We were in a wing last time with only a fast food chicken or the Speedway Grill as choices. We ended up at the latter, and were not impressed.

I particularly enjoy a trip through the Charlotte airport. I'm into a layover here and will plan accordingly when I can.

In the atrium there's a man playing live piano. Can we say calming? I wasn't even angry that my flight was delayed... Piano and a glass of rosé. Yes, please. I hit up Beaudevin for food. Lots of options to choose from here depending on your layover and food preference.

The bathrooms have the world's nicest attendants. I think we should first acknowledge that there are even attendants. Impressive!

I haven't had any issues getting around the airport either. Somewhat easy to navigate. It's bright and lots of options for food, drinks, plugs to charge, or rest in the rocking chairs (why not?). And free wifi, thank you.

Maybe it's the poor quality of airports around the country, but the low frills Charlotte airport ranks as one of the better ones. The terminals are all connected the central food court, so for those connecting you might have a long walk, but you won't have to deal with any transportation. The security check points are some of the fastest I've been to for TSA PreCheck as the Terminal B checkpoint is solely devoted to PreCheck -- a great setup to help get through faster! In addition, I find that checked bags, at least for priority passengers, come very quickly. 

I have fewer praises for the amenities. There is free WiFi if you watch and ad, which works well enough. However, the terminals could use an update -- the carpet is dingy and there are not enough charging stations. There's a fair number of food options, but they are all very expensive for the quality ($15 for a BBQ plate). 

I usually cut it pretty close with boarding times, and the quick TSA checkpoint as not yet let me down, so have to say Charlotte is one of the better airports in the country.

I wish I could give this airport a better rating as this is my go to airport when I visit my sister. Unfortunately for me, I usually fly delta and their terminal is still the old one that is in quite a need for an update. I know they are building a new terminal A and I hope that Delta moves over there as the current one needs a lot of improvements.

Last time I traveled through CLT I had some time and wondered over to the other terminal, much better but really surprised about the amount of Starbucks, I counted 4 total from terminal A to D.

While improving the terminal they need to add more outlets. I love that they offer free WI-FI.

Charlotte is a pretty nice airport.  It's a big hub for American.  There are moving sidewalks to help get you from one terminal to the next.  There are a decent variety of restaurants and shops in the terminal areas.  There are charging stations to plug in your phone or tablet.

I have not actually left the airport, only made connections here, so I can't comment on the baggage claim or rental car facilities.

This airport is not the best. Very little seating, fights for any outlet anyone can find to charge their device and a wheel layout which means a long walk between the A through F gate areas makes it less than fun to connect through. The amount of daily traffic chokes the place's HVAC system as well. With all of the seating next to the windows that makes the place a barn-scented sauna during peak travel times. 

The good; a decent tapas restaurant in the main eating area. 

The bad; this place needs to be renovated to handle the amount of traffic it is currently getting as flights are shifted to smaller regional planes.

Have not had the luck of having a connection from the same gate area here in Charlotte. Usually landing at a gate (pick a letter A-F) and having to traverse at least 15 minutes to the connecting gate. Some close calls due to delays and boarded just before doors closed in past trips...... BUT NOT TODAY! 
I was actually able to select a connection with 90 minutes to connect, arriving at my connecting gate 57 minutes prior to boarding. My flight from Ft Lauderdale to Charlotte landed on time but had to sit on tarmac for about 20 minutes before being allowed to enter the "corridor " to reach our arrival gate. I was in row 14 so deplaned pretty quickly. Navigating the B gates and a couple of moving walkways, (Stand to the Right and Walk to the Left.....PLEASE!) I made it to my C gate (this time it was not as far).
Now if they just don't change gates........

Coming from New York, this airport is lovely. They are quick and efficient. You're in and you're out, you're up and you're down. (you're wrong when it's right.. Katy Perry, no?) anyway, this airport is a relief compared to JFK and LGA. It felt great to be out of the airport so smoothly. The way home was just as easy.
Cute airport, in-and out very easily. Easy to get around and many dining options to buy some food before a flight.

Ok, so ive had a few times where I was stuck on layover in this airport and I will say it def wasn't the worst experience. Actually with the numerous food options I wasn't bad off at all! The security line is a little iffy and unorganized but nothing too serious. I went to school in High Point and they only had a 5am and 12 shuttle to CLT which sucked, but again I didn't mind gettin there super early because of all the food choices. That plus the cheap nonstop flights to BWI and ATL def make CLT a winner!

Hate to say it butteruhh this airport is not-so-great so i appoint it the star named:   "meh. I've experienced better." 

After quite a trek, I finally found myself at baggage claim, and in good company with all the others who were also---totally confused. Ummm, where the hell are my bags and how the hell will I find them?  That's the sentence (add an F word here and there) I said aloud to self while pacing the 'ZONES.'   Come to find out, you have to check the magical  "baggage boards"  first to help you with the search and rescue mission. 

So, once at the wall-O-baggage boards, I struggled to find my zone still. Why you say? Oh because Charlotte is an international hub which meant there were about 200 flights listed by departing city. And nope---not your departing city--but the departing city where you possibly connected. I mean, I can only assume that since OAK was no where on the board. So, when I located Phoenix---another huge hub---you have to then sort by airlines. Oy vey. But then the flights are listed by times...not in pacific time, or central time but eastern time. WTF. And even then...the times were no where near a time associated with any points in my day's travel. 

So here's what I did. Took a quick survey of where the majority of 'US Airways' flights were zoned and noticed most were Zone 2. So off I went in that direction AGAIN... Once there...Zone 2 was marked "luggage for all cancelled departures only"   This was due to alllll the cancelled flights due to the East coast winter storm\/blizzards.

AREYOUFRIGGINKIDDINGME?!. 

SNAFU!

So, being a fish out of water, I wandered around like a asinine derelict till over in the corner I spied my doppelganger tagging my bags as abandoned. After a not-so-Navi-like exchange of words, she insisted I dig out my baggage tags that I'd tossed in my purse at the crack of dawn about 12 hours ago. Then, at last, I was on my way... 

While the experience on the way home wasn't half as bad, it left a lot to be desired too. Shops, employees and overall customer service was for the birds.

Usually end up here for lengthy layovers. Some of the concourses are very nice and others feel old and dirty. Always check the airport screens when you are changing flights as they seem to change almost every time I've gone. 
It is a very large airport and your connecting flight will undoubtably be far from where you land so expect to be walking and with a short layover this may mean running.

CLT
  Depends on your carrier but there is some nice food options. It's been upgraded recently, funny the best food is on the domestic piers and the international piers have the least to offer. The First Flight Sushi is great, US has two lounges B and C

This airport is huge!  If you're here for a short layover be prepared to book it if your connecting flight is on the other side of the airport..it'll take a while!  Luckily I had plenty of time, but I saw tons of people running down the long terminal corridors to get to their gate. It's a nice airport, well kept and has plenty of space and seating.

Bathroom attendant, rocking chairs, spacious and modern facilities, numerous shopping and eating establishments (not outstanding, but better than the run of the mill choices at most other airports), a wine bar, and all the while being accessible to people coming in from other terminals without needing to go through another security checkpoint.

Thank you Charlotte, for making a layover bearable. You just need more airlines. But you're definitely a world-class airport.
Overall a great experience here.  Food options weren't the greatest but I didn't see anything except for the terminal i left and came out of.

Very nice airport and quite large. Not a place to dilly dally in between  flights. You will get exercise hustling from one terminal  to the next. Nice variety  of eating  places, and nice shops. Actually not a bad place to be in between flights and you have a chance to browse.
Delayed flights all around and sharing seating with another gate is ridiculous. Had to watch my step or else I would've stepped on someone. Only redeeming thing was Bojangles.

You gotta love an airport with rocking chairs!

Welcome to CLT!!  Granted there are nicer, larger airports throughout the country that have better restaurant options, etc, but there's something about CLT airport that is familiar and comfortable.  It's quaint, people are nice, and yes, there are rocking chairs.  There's good signage to get you from point A to B and decent (not great) but decent eateries along the way.  My fav of which is Jamba Juice - definitely check them out!

The D terminal seems to be the nicest, newest looking terminal.  There's a rum bar, ale house, gourmet to go food section, and the gates are large.  The other terminals tend to have a very small seating section at the gates, spilling people into the walk-way which inevitably ends up blocking foot traffic (and of course the motorized carts) which can be annoying.  

What else can I say - it's an airport - been to better, been to worse.  All  in all, I try to stop over in CLT if I can't fly direct.

I would avoid, this airport if possible because it's really BIG and confusing! I got lost, several times, and my gate\/ terminal kept changing. The Staff, is unorganized, and nowhere to be seen. I had delays here too!

This is the most outdated and dingy major city airport I've ever seen. I was shocked that such a large beautiful and clean city has this to offer as it's first and last impression. CLT is begging for a major renovation!

The location, however, is stellar. A super short jaunt to the metro area. They also have a Cinnabon and that counts for a lot in my book.

This airport is just kinda weird. I went to the Caribbean via US Air and had to transfer here twice. The first time I was able to sneak onto the early flight in the adjacent gate, so I didn't spend much time here. The second time though, I had a 3 hour layover, so I was able to do some wandering.

Customs and Immigration was about average in terms of time and service. When I got through, I had to go through security again. This was the main weird part for me. There was a VERY high tech security scanning system that was not your typical metal detector. You have to stand and turn and then they scan you. JFK is my main airport, and nothing there even comes close to the CIA system in place here. And it's safe to say JFK has a much higher demand for an elaborate security system than CDT. 

My next complaint was that the result of this security system, the line moved verrrryyyyyy slowwwwly. It was not streamlined at all, and it took much longer than necessary because the employees were just really laid back and not in any rush. This didn't affect me because I'm a lunatic who leaves exorbitant amounts of time in between airline connections, but it IS a US Air hub and some people need to make their connections! Pick up the pace guys!

Once I got through, there was a nice central atrium with Adirondack chairs and then dated low-ceilinged hubs with generic seating areas. The central atrium was actually pleasant to spend some time in. As far as food goes, there was typical stuff, but also a Papa John's. It's nice to not have to rely on Sbarro and Famous Famiglia, and my Papa John's was pretty tasty. If I wasn't traveling alone, I probably would have chosen the tequila driven Tex Mex place too, which had a bar and some tables.

KCLT is to airports what Honey Nut Spooners is to brand name cereal. Every time I land here there is an insanely long taxi to the gate usually accompanied by some form a ground movement delay. Top that with the fact that the terminal is shaped like a hand which means if you must change terminals, the walk will be atrocious. Seriously...IHTFP.

Great food! Really they do! They don't have a lot of shops, but they do have variety of food! 

I had to connect from domestic to international and it was easy to get to, which was not bad.

The people were nice and the airport felt clean. 

I was flying US Airways and taking it to Brazil, overall the experience was not bad, but I dislike long flights and red eyes.
It was a pass through. When I stopped by, it was pretty crowded and there was a dearth of outlets

I'm totally a west coast traveler but when I fly to visit my friend in Boston I had a layover here for a couple of hours. 

Now given the fact it was 6AM in the morning a lot of the restaurants were open, which was really nice. I didn't just have to choose from Starbucks and Burger King. 

I love the layout and how spacious this airport is too. Not to most modern, but clean and easy to navigate. I'd be happy to have a layover here again.

I will admit that this review should have been written months ago since we flew last October, but it took all these months to recover from our horrible experience and be able to discuss it without Valium.

Oh dear, where to begin...Charlotte was our one stop between Boston and Pensacola, and my husband had previously suffered at Charlotte Airport so his expectations were low. On our way down to FL there were no issues to speak of, except to mention that one needs a good 20 minutes extra to get from one side of the building to the other. While there are miles of moving walkways, most often there are people standing in the walking lane or parents trying to get their little angel to pose for a picture while harried travelers are scrambling to catch their connecting flight.

On our return stopover, we were on schedule to catch our flight back to Boston when the pilot announced that there seemed to be an issue in Charlotte. We knew this could not be a good thing.

What ensued was a complete cluster on the part of Charlotte personnel. We learned much, much later (like after we missed our connecting flight) that one of the moving walkways in the middle of the building caught fire. Okay, so you're saying, "hey that's not their fault" but it was the complete lack of leadership, lack of personnel to keep throngs of anxious passengers calm, lack of transparency about the ongoing situation, etc.

We were held hostage for what seemed like an eternity,  while one airport worker would tell people that shuttle busses would be forming at a certain gate to transport passengers to the other side of the airport, so the masses would scramble to get there, only to be told later that busses weren't coming. Then we're told okay maybe they are coming, but to a different gate. Announcements were made that all planes were grounded and no one would miss their flight, only to get to the gate after the fiasco to learn all flights left on schedule.

The mob scene that ensued once the fire was cleared was nothing short of a disaster film. Pushing and shoving to cram onto escalators, maneuvering around fire apparatus...had this been an actual emergency, you would probably just take a seat and kiss your a** goodbye.

We waited THREE HOURS for the next plane that wasn't already full, paid an outrageous amount of money for food and drink to pass the time (because after that, yeah you need drinks and money is no object.)

We're flying to Pensacola again this year, and our layover will NOT be in Charlotte. Ever. Again.

Not a bad airport , big enough to be interesting , but not so large that you will get lost getting to your next flight. I wish they still had the Harley t shirt shop in the airport, sadly it is gone. Some good food, not a bad place to hang out between flights, was there over the 4th. It was very hot , but at least the airport was kept cool, much unlike Myrtle Beach. That airport was awful.

Pretty good overall. the concourses are designed to require lots of walking to go from one to another, but there are good people movers to help if they are working. An abundance of white rocking chairs sets a relaxed mood...and more comfortable than the standard airport chairs.  Plenty of eating places. A bit put off by having a men's room attendant tearing off sheets of paper for hand washers.....with extended palm and giant bottle of listerine.

I'm a US Airways Express pilot, so needless to say, I'm in Charlotte A TON. I have noticed that check in lines can be quite lengthy, but most airports of this size usually have similarly lengthy lines. The other thing is that it could use a few more Arrival \/ Departure information screens. Otherwise though, it's a very nice airport. The food court area is a great spot to kill time, eat, people watch, and relax. The moving sidewalks help a ton when you have to get from one end of the airport to another. Delays can be quite lengthy, so be prepared. When the weather drops, the headaches WILL rise. Driving into the airport is easy and so is the parking. All in all, it's a decent airport. I hope this helps!

Not a bad layout for a large airport.  Lots of convenience here.  Lots of places to shop and eat which makes it nice if you're having to lay over for more than an hour.  I don't like monster airports.
Comfy chairs, free wifi, decent terminal layout, bagels for breakfast and BBQ for every other time, this is a great place to stop if you've got a bit of time between flights.

New, clean, modern airport, which feels well designed and easy to walk from terminal to terminal.  No need to catch a train to go from terminal A to E. Great selection of shops and restaurants. I pasted 5 Starbucks on my way to the E gates, and saw long line for each store.

Wow this is one busy airport! The place was bustling with activity despite it being a workday late morning. Despite that the airport is clean, restrooms topnotch and hygienic. All the airport,airline staff,restroom attendant that I encountered were polite,cheerful and extremely helpful. In terminal B there were several great food choices and not just chain restaurant options. 

Only downside probably would be the still dingy carpet the airport sports. 

Overall a great airport to fly into or have a layover at!

Was just stopping through on our way to Las Vegas. 

It was 7:00AM in the morning...the Starbucks line moved quickly...and everyone was friendly.

Thats enough for at least 4 stars :)
Love those Carolina Rockers. One of my favorite airports. Lots of plugs and charging stations. Great BBQ. Easy to get from one end of the airport to the other.

Nice airport. Not too crowded. Good ribs place in the food court.

US Airways is another story...

I feel silly writing about an airport, but this one was really awesome! Beautiful, huge, super clean, tons of food options from your -can find everywhere in America fast food- to your more upscale bars and bistro food. We had a piano player, tons of outlets for your phones and bathrooms at every corner. 
Charlotte's airport make traveling and connecting a very smooth and agreeable experience :) thank you!

This airport isn't much different than others. It is easy to find your way around, offers lots of options on food should you get stuck here for a lengthy time. The area for rental cars was under construction when I visited, meaning you have to walk outside and across the street to rent your car. Which I didn't mind because at least it isn't like other airports where you have to shuttle away from the property to just get to the rental counter. That aside this place was clean and the TSA line wasn't obnoxiously long. Although... Because there is only one terminal area for all flights there are three maybe four TSA lines to pick from. So be careful that you don't pick one that is heavily trafficked, and don't think all lines are that bad if you do. Our first sight of one of the TSA lines would easily have had us waiting for over an hour, but I waited in line while my friend ran to check out another, only to discover that another line was nowhere near as long. So I hurried across the airport to join them and we were in and out of TSA in maybe 5-10min. Good airport to be in.

A less expensive choice than Durham from Milwaukee and it's a nice minor  hub.  It's bigger than a small airport, but not a monstrosity like O'hare, Dallas or Atlanta so I'm going to prefer it for connections when possible in the future.  Good selection of shops and eating choices inside check in, security is good both in terms of catching shampoo but also in being fairly quick and polite.  I'm kind of a walking test of these sorts of things because 8 hours after my last shave I look like what you would get if you were a director's assistant and called for a terrorist looking actor from central casting.  You're in for a pretty long walk from terminal to baggage claim to car rental desk to your rental car and then back again so be prepared.

Just got back from a vacation in Jamaica and was pleased at the customer service we received going through customs in Charlotte. I have read many reviews that say otherwise. But I would like to say our experience was great!

Five stars for a commercial airport. Weird, huh?

If I were to get stuck in ANY airport in the country, I would want to get stuck in Charlotte.

Big, sunny terminals.
Rocking chairs by windows for soothing those flight-related annoyances.
LOTS of shopping and food options.
Salons, manicurists, massage chairs for those more taxing layovers and delays.
Plenty of seats at each gate, and a fairly high frequency of outlets.
FREE WI-FI!!!

If you MUST choose a connecting city in the area, skip anywhere in DC and opt for Charlotte.

Oh my gosh is this airport huge. I got in on an hour delayed flight out of Knoxville, which only gave me 20 min to run from B terminal all the way to E terminal. There were so many people and our flight, every seat was filled going to Detroit. I had no place to sit while waiting at my gate, people were sitting on the floor...no thank you. As tired I was that night, I just stood and waited. The boarding process took over 30min, and that's when I say thank goodness for first class! First to board and get your carry on luggage squared away, and the first to leave the plane upon arrival.

I travelled to charlottle airport and back from the UK last year and it was a simple and easy process with this airport causing no problems, especially with my luggage, although my plane back to the UK was delayed o.O

The airport is okay as far as large hub airports go. However, the security checkpoint is small with a pretty bad bottle neck for screening. I found this to be a bit slow and crowded more space would have been appreciated and made this a more pleasent experience. 

On the upside baggage claim divisions were well spread out to prevent crowding with good signage and listings of where to go for your particular flight.  The fountain outside by the ground transport sites makes a nice view while waiting for your ride or shuttle.

Overall okay airport, not bad or great, just okay.
Well Charlotte is always busy but reasonably easy to navigate to your next gate if your lay over is here.  I have flown many miles and I like this airport a lot

the airport has certainly grown over the last 10 years.  great ambiance with the rocking chairs in the atrium for passengers that have a long wait between flights and do not wish to wait at their gate.  continue to grow and hurry up and finish with the construction with the parking!!!

This is the US Airways hub in Charlotte and it's a pretty sweet airport. It's not a behemoth like other airports (LAX, ORD, etc.) but still has plenty of connections. I like the different local restaurants and the fact that you can get from different terminals relatively quickly and without having to go through security.

Admiral's Club in terminal B is nice. Nice staff and decent snacks for America. It's easily accessible to the various AA and US Air gates.

Recommended.

My brother arrived  today from Germany and was ordered around by immigration at your airport. Plenty of open booths without lines but no he had to wait in line to show his passport while officers were too busy attending to their cell phones or bossing arriving foreigners. He is a businessman leaving lots of money in your city. Not a nice welcome especially on NFL playoff day. Hopefully Lufthansa will terminate flying to a city that does not welcome German nationals.
